item.title: Pakistan's new pink buses aim to make travel safer for women
item.description: Pakistan's Karachi city has added pink public buses to help women feel safe - but the broader structural problem of sexual harassment remains.
item.keywords: DWVC,Pakistan, pink bus, public transport, women, sexual harrassment
item.media:title: Pakistan's new pink buses aim to make travel safer for women
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Pakistan, pink bus, public transport, weomen, sexual harrassment

item.title: Indian brides abandoned after marriage for their dowry
item.description: Brides in India are getting left empty handed after their weddings. They shell out thousands for the wedding and a dowry just for their would-be husbands to disappear soon after the ceremony. Thousands are looking for help from the government but authorities have few options in tracking and punishing the absentee husbands.
item.keywords: DWVC,India, brides, marriage, dowry, wedding scheme
item.media:title: Indian brides abandoned after marriage for their dowry
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,India, brides, marriage, dowry, wedding scheme

item.title: Bacteria-powered light
item.description: Go visit Rambouillet in France and you'll find glow worms lighting up advertisements. Authorities there are looking at light from living organisms as a sustainable alternative to artificial lighting.
item.keywords: DWVC,Bioluminesence, light, electricity, bacteria, glowworm, fish, France
item.media:title: Bacteria-powered light
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Bioluminesence, light, electricity, bacteria, glowworm, fish, France

item.title: Peace singers of Cyprus
item.description: A Greek-Turkish peace choir wants to overcome the divisions in Cyprus. The two parts of the island have a long history of conflict. The choir singers only wish for peace and reunification.
item.keywords: DWVC,Cyprus, Turkey, Cyprus conflict, peace initiative, choir, peacebuilding, reunification
item.media:title: Peace singers of Cyprus
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Cyprus, Turkey, Cyprus conflict, peace initiative, choir, peacebuilding, reunification

item.title: "Biggest strike in decades" brings Germany to a standstill
item.description: Public sector strikes focused mainly on public transport halted the vast majority of buses, trains and planes in Germany on Monday. The 24-hour action began at midnight. It's part of a long-running dispute over pay and the soaring cost of living.
item.keywords: DWVC,Germany, strike, public transport, public sector, pay dispute, union, wages, rate, cost of living, inflation
item.media:title: â€˜Biggest strike in decadesâ€™ brings Germany to a standstill
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Germany, strike, public transport, public sector, pay dispute, union, wages, rate, cost of living, inflation

item.title: Tornado: Rolling Fork wiped out
item.description: Tornado damage in Rolling Fork, a predominantly Black town of about 2,000 people in Mississippi, has been devastating. A Red Cross official described it as "like a war zone."
item.keywords: DWVC,United States, Mississippi, Rolling Fork, Tornado, catastrophe
item.media:title: Tornado: Rolling Fork wiped out
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,United States, Mississippi, Rolling Fork, Tornado, catastrophe

item.title: Kissing and long-distance? Everything is possible
item.description: A smartphone device that allows people to kissâ€¦remotely. It was inspired by the isolation of couples during China's COVID-19 lockdowns and it's dividing opinions on Chinese social media. Do you think it's hot or gross? @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,China, technology, long-distance relationships, COVID-19, remote intimacy, physical distancing, innovation, controversial, romantic, unconventional
item.media:title: Kissing and long-distance? Everything is possible

item.title: Kerala temple deploys robotic elephant for rituals
item.description: Elephants play an important role in Kerala during temple festivals but are often chained and made to stand for hours in extreme temperatures. A temple in the South Indian state has introduced a robotic elephant to conduct its rituals. Could this bring a change in tradition?
item.keywords: DWVC,elephants, Kerala, India, temple festivals, animal welfare, tradition, robots, technology, culture, temple rituals, ethical treatment, societal change
item.media:title: Kerala temple deploys robotic elephant for rituals
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,elephants, Kerala, India, temple festivals, animal welfare, tradition, robots, technology, culture, temple rituals, ethical treatment, societal change

item.title: Nigeriaâ€™s teen tech wonder
item.description: Joshua Agboola has been programming since he was 6 and today, as a teenager, even teaches other kids to code. The tech prodigy not only spreads knowledge, but also protects others: One of Joshuas's focuses is on how to protect children from malicious content online.
item.keywords: DWVC,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection
item.media:title: Nigeriaâ€™s teen tech wonder
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Nigeria, Africa, early programming, child programmer, coding education, youth mentorship, tech prodigy, knowledge sharing, child safety online, internet safety, cybersecurity, online protection

item.title: Uganda's new anti-gay law
item.description: 10 years in prison for identifying as LGBTQ, five for promoting homosexuality - Uganda's parliament has passed tough new penalties for same-sex relations. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,Uganda, homophobia, LGBTQI+, homosexuality, anti-gay law
item.media:title: Uganda's new anti-gay law
item.media:keywords: DWVC, vertical content, mobile content,Uganda, homophobia, LGBTQI+, homosexuality, anti-gay law
